channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wall Street is scared that we’re looking at the end of the Fed’s independence
item.description: The bond market flinched yesterday and stocks sold off.

item.title: The ESPN app has landed: ‘We can’t look at this launch as a movie opening’
item.description: Following the fans: Jimmy Pitaro is betting big on the new ESPN app. [Photo: Mackenzie Stroh] On August 21, the self-described “leading multi-platform...

item.title: Exclusive: Twin Health, metabolic health startup, raises $53 million Series E at $950 million valuation
item.description: Twin Health raised a $53 million Series E led by Maj Invest of Denmark, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: AI is already shaping the future . So why do so few of us get to decide what that future will be?
item.description: In Silicon Valley boardrooms, a small group of executives is quietly making decisions that will shape the lives of billions. And most of us won’t know...

item.title: Why Efficiency Is Great—Until It’s Not
item.description: CEOs and CFOs of public companies have been efficiency-pilled. Once visionaries, they’re now hatchetmen.

item.title: Teenage Engineering’s first free product buys it new customers for under $9

item.title: Fed Rate Cuts Are Imminent. The Bull and Bear Case
item.description: President Trump and Jerome Powell disagree on monetary policy.

item.title: This Gen Zer washed his college basketball team’s dirty clothes to prove his passion—now he’s one of the youngest interns ever at the NBA
item.description: Mocked as ‘mop boy,’ Daniel Sung turned a year of college basketball grunt work into a dream NBA internship, LinkedIn fame, and multiple startup offer...

item.title: How This Founder Sold His Vibe-Coding Startup for $80 Million Just 4 Months After Launching It
item.description: Maor Shlomo created and then sold Base44 to Wix in the blink of an eye.

item.title: Don’t Wait — Use This Neuroscientist’s Principles to Stop Procrastinating
item.description: This neuroscience-backed method will help you pinpoint the exact cause of your procrastination so you can finally beat it.

item.title: Beyond snubbing Tinder, Bumble, and casual flings, more than half of Gen Z is spending $0 monthly on dating, BofA finds
item.description: Gen Z’s economic anxiety—as well as disinterest in casual dating—has led many young people to spend little to nothing on dates.

item.title: Tech debt isn’t an ‘IT issue.’ It’s a business strategy

item.title: Where on the moon NASA places its nuclear reactor isn’t simple

item.title: Starbucks’ CEO is ditching a merit system and giving all salaried staff a flat 2% pay raise instead
item.description: The coffee chain cited limiting costs during a turnaround effort as it’s reason for the modest pay bump.

item.title: Target Just Made a Big Announcement. Here’s the Inspiring Story
item.description: Do many interns expect that they’ll eventually rise to the top job?
